revised_title: Successful Treatment of a Stab Wound to the Intestine
tldr: A case study details the successful treatment of a man who suffered a stab wound to the ileum, a part of the small intestine. Mr. Peter Travers, a surgeon in Lisbon, performed the surgery and treated the patient with a combination of bloodletting, clysters, and other medical interventions. The patient made a full recovery within several weeks.
